purpose: The email announces the 7th International Workshop on Formal Methods for Autonomous Systems (FMAS 2025), scheduled to take place in Paris, France from November 17 to 19, 2025. It invites researchers to submit papers on formal verification techniques for autonomous systems, highlighting key challenges and encouraging collaboration. The email outlines important dates for submissions and notifications, details the scope and topics of interest, and describes the submission categories and publication process. Additionally, it mentions a special topic on Human-AI Teams and provides information about participation options, including in-person and remote attendance.

evidence_sentences: FMAS 2025 is a 2.5-day peer-reviewed international workshop that brings together researchers working on a range of techniques for the formal verification of autonomous systems.
FMAS welcomes submissions that use formal methods to specify, model, or verify autonomous systems; in whole or in part.
Topics of interest include (but are not limited to): Applicable, tool-supported Formal Methods that are suited to Autonomous Systems.
In addition to the topics above, we would like to invite work on formal methods for human-AI teamwork.
There are four categories of submission: Vision papers, Research previews, Experience report papers, Regular papers.
FMAS 2025 will honour the best paper selected with respect to reviews, programme committee discussions, and conference presentations with an award.
We will accept participation in-person and remotely.
